t: Amazon is dropping dozens of in-house brands you didn’t even know it owned | The Verge
s: August 10, 2023 - Amazon is getting rid of dozens of in-house clothing brands as it faces a potential antitrust lawsuit from the FTC, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal.

13 hours ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: Amazon's new shopping feature lets you search for products even if they're not sold on Amazon
